p: Mosquito-borne Zika virus (ZIKV) is an emerging flavivirus initially reported in Africa in 1947 [ 1]. Recently, ZIKV became a public health concern with recent epidemics occurring in Yap islands (2007), French Polynesia (2013), and South America (2015) [ 2]. During these outbreaks, ZIKV infection was reported to cause severe complications in humans, such as developmental abnormalities in infants and Guillain-Barre syndrome in adults [ 3]. Also, ZIKV is capable of long-term persistence in human body fluids and sexual transmission of disease has been documented [ 4, 5].
